data.title: Birthday celebration
data.text: The Lilac has a welcoming interior and is decorated with elegance. The food was rather expensive and very small portions. One in our party was celebrating a birthday but the restaurant did not acknowledge it, which was disappointing for what appears to be an upscale restaurant. The dress code is very casual (One guy was even wearing a baseball cap during dinner at night!)

data.title: Always Yummy
data.text: One of my favorite Billings restaurants.  The food is beautifully presented and the favors devine.  Fun to be in Montana Ave too.

data.title: Slightly inconsistent but overall very good!
data.text:
I had dinner at Lilac. The service was excellent - honest, low key, knowledgeable and friendly. The food was somewhat inconsistent. The polenta in my dish, for example, had truly great flavor and I scraped every last bit of it off my plate. But it was lukewarm when it arrived. The salmon, on the other hand, was piping hot. It was a little overcooked in one corner. I wouldn't normally be so picky, but at $30 a plate, I expected a more consistently cooked meal. 
Dessert was great - my bread pudding was not too sweet, it was very light, and the flavors were really well balanced.
It seems like the portions are very reasonably sized; you won't overeat here. Great for a special occasion.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: Lilac is definitely on my list of must-visit places when I'm in Billings.   Tonight was my first visit, but definitely not my last.  The Copper River Coho salmon with glazed heirloom carrots and mustard green-walnut pesto was exquisite perhaps one of the best preparations I've ever tasted.  I'm only sorry I didn't have room to try the coffee and doughnuts dessert.

data.title: Eclectic menu
data.text:
My first visit, but my wife has been there before.  We had invited another couple who have also been there.  The menu changes depending on the season.  We started by asking for some bread and ordered the "Moroccan Carrot Matbucha" for an appetizer which was good but could have had a few more chips with it.  We only had two other plates purely by chance when we ordered.  We had the "Beef Tongue Tacos" and "Grilled Squash & Poblano Ravioli".  I had the tacos, tender and tasty, not a menu item that I seen before, good for them for having this.  My wife liked the ravioli, it was well presented.  Both couples split a desert, one was plenty for two, the apple crisp. We had the toffee pudding which I felt was about a half a portion to small.
The area is open and was full of diners, I didn't feel it was noisy. We never felt rushed and enjoyed two different wines.  Large wine list and decent assortment of beers.
Don't expect huge portions, this is not a Montana surf and turf style place.

data.title: Innovative and fabulous
data.text: Our first dining experience at Lilac will not be our last. The tight, eclectic menu surprised and delighted us at every turn. Who would have thought that crispy chicken skins could taste so good? Every course was a winner and the farro fried rice with pork belly was outstanding. We learnt that members of Lilac's team rotate through the various roles in the kitchen and are encouraged to design new dishes: our server for the evening was also a chef who had produced one of the specials that night, whilst the person on dishwashing duties had created the superb 'coffee and doughnuts' dessert that was kindly modified to tea and doughnuts to better sate our English palate.

data.title: brunch
data.text: Excellent place to have a Sunday brunch! Different menu to choose from. We enjoyed excellent service and an excellent meal with smoked trout scrambled eggs and poached eggs with a delicious locally made sausage.

data.title: Best restaurant in Billings
data.text: In my opinion there is no better place to dine in Billings. Authentic, creative and just plain tasty.

data.title: Smoked trout scrambled eggs !!!!!!!
data.text:
Our group ate here on7/24 and all I can say is it was amazing
I wanted to order a plated of the smoked trout scrambled eggs to go our whole party was elated with their meal.

All I can say is this is a must stop if in the area. The Sunday brunch is excellent. Get there by 9:00, space is limited.

data.title: Unexpected joy
data.text: Wonderful chef owned & run restaurant . This would do well in any major city.  After traveling over two weeks we were delighted to just walk in for a great unique meal.

data.title: Wonderful new upscale restaurant in downtown Billings
data.text:
The food was outstanding, both for flavor and presentation. Both dishes that we had used unusual sauces and spices, making for a delicious meal. We shared the butter lettuce salad which was also very good. We hope to be back in Billings soon and will certainly go back to the same place! Other things on the menu also looked good.
The service was exemplary. The owner/manager? greeted us at the door in a very welcoming, friendly  manner and the waiter was perfect - knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive without being too much so.

data.title: Enjoyed the great food!
data.text: This restaurant is known for their seasonal selections although there are some items that remain on the menu. We started with the house French Fries. I know it doesn't sound like a great appetizer but these fries were excellent. I had the beef tongue tacos and my wife had the braised short ribs with gnocchi. Both of these items were delicious also. We recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: I was skeptical of Lilac at first because of the 'small, medium, large' plate set up. I never know what to order. But, I am so glad we ate here. Everything was delicious. We ended up sharing a bunch of different plates, and each one was better than the one before. The brussel sprouts and chicken skins were the table favorite. I loved the short rib with potato gnocchi. A large plate is alllmost too much for one person. Two people could probably share a large and medium plate, especially if you get a dessert. The desserts were amazing. And the prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Great Brunch
data.text: Had Sunday brunch today and really enjoyed it. We made a reservation but I don't think we needed to. The atmosphere is very pleasant. Wait staff quick and attentive. Try the chocolate croissant and the trout scramble! Mimosas were tasty as well! Be mindful of the hours, they close at 1pm!

data.title: Great meal
data.text: A diamond in Billings.  Fresh food that is locally sourced and organic with an amazing variety on the menu. Decent wine list and reasonably priced.  Open kitchen and young friendly staff.  If you only have one dinner in Billings. Eat it here.

data.title: Excellent Food in Billings
data.text: Great modern American cuisine with a rotating menu and exceptional service.  The braised short rib is a regular entree on the menu and it is rich and flavorful. The "coffee and doughnuts" for dessert was also excellent.

data.title: Not too shabby for being in Billings
data.text: had the fish special. very tasty and the sauteed celery was outstanding as was the service.. Coffee left a lot to be desired but didn't expect much. Dessert was good..

data.title: Our Favorite spot. Something a little different
data.text: When we want a treat this is where we go. The menu changes frequently so there are always new and wonderful things to try.Always unique. You will probably need a reservation as it gets really busy. We usually just stop in an sit and eat at the bar. Wait staff is great and if you have special diet needs call a day ahead and they will make something special just for you.

data.title: Oh my! Very good
data.text: What a nice surprise. This was recommended by friends and we were pleasantly surprised because the outside does not look like a great place to eat. But once inside and you smell the delicious aromas greeting your senses you'll think so too. Delicious coffee. Unusual menu items that delight your palate.  A must try place.

data.title: Love Lilac!!!
data.text:
Great small restaurant. Menu is tapas style with small plates, medium plates and large entree plates. Nice wine list.

Each of the several small plates we tried was excellent. 

My husband had the striped bass special and it was so perfectly done. I had the roasted zucchini on naan entree, very tasty!

Desserts also super. Mine featured small batch coffee ice cream, the best I've had.

Lilac will be one of our favorite Billings restaurants!
